website_summaries.verdict: A good pick for home use, this jack's cradle is best suited for automatic transmissions, but can be adapted for use with standard transmissions.
pros: Saddle allows for full side-to-side and front-to-back adjustment
Reinforced base with a wide stance
Factory tested for safety and reliability
Steel swivel bearing casters Minimum clearance of 8.66 inches
cons: The provided chains are not of the best quality

customer_reviews.title: Please inspect before use!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to check the angle adjustment nuts. Went to pull a tranny from my F450 and the cheap lock nut fell off causing the transmission to lean like a son of a. And almost got me. If you know what I mean. Thank God I chained it, and was able to ease it on it's side. Was pretty dangerous if you ask me. Also check to be sure you have bearings on both sides of the angle adjustment shaft. Mine was Missing them on 1 side. Didn't notice it because they used 4 washers in it's place. Should be a good jack with a few modifications.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful jack
customer_reviews.text: It arrived early, ... but had been damaged. One of the knobs had taken a hit and was cracked & bent, ... well heck, ... repairable. Other than that, ...just fine. I am happy that I no longer have to rent ..... This unit comes in handy for other projects too. My tranny is attached to my transfer case, so ratcheting straps were necessary to hold it securely to the jack. I had none of the issues that were mentioned by other reviews ..... nice unit !
customer_reviews.author: AWK

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised how well this worked
customer_reviews.text: Preformed much better then I expected. Adjustments work well. Raises and lowers under control. Only thing I would change is the chain attachment point. It works fine just think it could be stronger. Thanks for a great product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Knapp

customer_reviews.title: Don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money very cheap and unsafe had a transmission fall off and smash my hand because the bolts are not long enough for the brackets that hold it the main plate
customer_reviews.author: edmund morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great jack, fast shipping, awful handling.
customer_reviews.text: This transmission jack was delivered earlier today. Will update review if need. Welds look good; everything is in the box. Shipping was super fast, 4 days early. On the other hand, box looked mangled and beaten to the point that two of the casters are sticking out of the box. minus some scratches and minor dents, all looks well for the jack. Chains do look cheap, I would suggest getting stronger chains if you plan on using them.
customer_reviews.author: drew blumm

customer_reviews.title: Have to do some modifying.
customer_reviews.text: The jack itself is great, throw away the chain hanger/tightener. Its not the best thougt out. However if you don't have time to modify, couple 1k rachet straps will hold tranny in place.
customer_reviews.author: J H.

customer_reviews.title: overall good floor jack for small jobs
customer_reviews.text: I wish they would do a better job shipping this product because when I received it the box was a little beat up and one of the plastic handles was shattered. I used this for a 700R4 transmission as well as a Chevrolet step van differential. after doing these two jobs the saddle became very loose and one of the support arms bent a little. not too bad overall especially if you are on a budget like I was.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of trash do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Terrible terrible terrible. Do not buy this. The angle adjuster broke while the transmission was going back in, blew out the bearings everywhere, and dropped the transmission. Luckily I was able to cradle it down softly but it could have been so much worse. Total garbage and this was my only time using it after unpacking it
customer_reviews.author: Austin York

customer_reviews.title: Made a difficult job easy
customer_reviews.text: I used this to mount a transaxle onto a 4-cylinder Honda engine with an active torque transfer system requiring the alignment of 3 sets of splined shafts all at once. I couldn't have done it without this jack -- the mounting plate tilts in both directions (roll and pitch if you prefer), so you can very accurately align the transmission. I did forego the included chain to secure the tranny and used a ratcheting strap instead -- your call.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Hunsaker

customer_reviews.title: For casual Saturday mechanics only...
customer_reviews.text: Just a step above convincing a buddy to hold up the transmission while you bolt it in. The platform flops around quite a bit, so you have to sort of place the transmission on off-center to keep it on one side of the balance point or the other. A few local stores wanted $1,000 for a similar, but very high quality product. If I had that kind of money, I'd just pay my mechanic to do the work for me.
customer_reviews.author: JRod

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: worked to hold up my Fuso transmission. Next job is my jeep.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Not the best but quite adequite
customer_reviews.text: The jack is just as advertised. It also arrived on time and in the factory box. It is heavy but well constructed. Watch the relief valve as it will let down the load quickly if not gently unscrewed. Many years has taught me this with some jacks of lesser quality. I so recommend this jack to those who know what to ndo with a tranny lift. I would go to this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: Browser

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good jack for the price plastic knobs were broke on arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Shipping box was original product box and was pretty beaten up
customer_reviews.text: Same as other reviews. Shipping box was original product box and was pretty beaten up. Jack was in good condition. Pressure relief valve is very sensitive and will lower very rapidly. Chains to hold xmission in place are a joke. The jack itself does do the job quite nicely. Used to remove xmission and transfer case on 97 Tacoma.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Flintstoney

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good, but it's a cheap unit
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty good, but it's a cheap unit. I found that when I tilted the transmission back, the transmission hit on the tilt knob and bent it a little, making it hard to twist. Mine was also missing a snap ring for one of the pins.
customer_reviews.author: derf

customer_reviews.title: Could be 5 stars with a little qc. The ...
customer_reviews.text: Could be 5 stars with a little qc. The handle receiver on mine was misshapen, so the handle didn't fit all the way in. I still got the job done and for well under a dealership price so I can't complain too much. If I had a do over I would have gotten the one for $100 at Farbor Hreight
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: The adjusting knobs
customer_reviews.text: The jack is made well but the adjusting knobs are cheap plastic and break easy which make adjustments impossible
customer_reviews.author: Jay K Jones

customer_reviews.title: I have had a great time using this jack
customer_reviews.text: I have had a great time using this jack. Today, my brother and I used it to pull and reinstall a ford c6 out of a 1982 f150. The jack made the removing and repositioning of the transmission effortless. I can't wait to use it again!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua R. Zammit

customer_reviews.title: made dropping the transmission way easier...
customer_reviews.text: ...than using a regular floor jack. The handle for tilting forward or back could stand to be a little shorter to allow for easier/more adjustment rearward, but aside from that, I dont really have anything negative to say about it. I used this jack to remove a t-56 from a mustang.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the part-time mechanic
customer_reviews.text: Boy, using a transmission jack sure makes trans removal and then alignment with the engine easier. This tool is well worth the price. The jack and table itself is sturdy and easily held a large diesel pickup transmission. The chain and tensioner is pretty cheesy. I use a ratcheting strap instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value, good for once in a while use
customer_reviews.text: Works great when evenly loaded, grease the adjusting bolts. Good maneuvering, ratchet straps are key
customer_reviews.author: Guywithdrill

customer_reviews.title: It was exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this if I depended on it for my living, but for the once every 2 years that I will use it it's great. Way better and more controlled than any floor jack strategy I have used in the past. Yes the knobs and casters are plastic, but for the price it it's a functional unit.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy X

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality for the price. Shipping wasn't too bad and we're very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Shively

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product used to hold transmission up for more than a month didn't lose pressure
customer_reviews.author: Langton hall

customer_reviews.title: This is a great jack! It made getting the transmission out of ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great jack! It made getting the transmission out of my F150 a whole lot easier. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hutcheson

customer_reviews.title: the jack broke with the transmission lifted in the air ...
customer_reviews.text: the jack broke with the transmission lifted in the air causing the trans and jack to fall over breaking the transmission housing and costing me a new trans.....buyer beware!!!! more Chinese imported junk!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack
customer_reviews.text: This jack was just what I needed for the project I had going on. It worked quite well and handled a heavy, awkward job.
customer_reviews.author: JohnJen

customer_reviews.title: Strong design, stable, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, nice adjustments make the jack easy to use, with additional side to side and front to back angle adjustments. Difficult job without, a simple, safe job with. Heavy duty design, very heavy metal casters.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for what I needed to do
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for what I needed to do. Wish it came with an adapter that had a hole in the middle for the transmission oil pan but it worked with some maneuvering.
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Good Jack
customer_reviews.text: It works very well. It does all I need to do. Very easy to use it is easy to adjust to fit.
customer_reviews.author: tracker 90

customer_reviews.title: Garbage!
customer_reviews.text: Collapsed with the transmission in the air! Transmission feel on me and bruised my ribs! Buy American! !!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Worked well once - then failed.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for - we used it on about a 8" lifted old Chevy, lifting a 700r4, and it worked well. Unfortunately, we had this model for less than a year - we did the first transmission and tried a second less than 6 months later, on a heavier sm465 in a different truck (no lift kit) and the hydraulic lift on the jack failed, dropped the transmission & screwed up the clutch too. It's cheap, worked well on one job, with a relatively lighter transmission, but if you're looking at using this on a regular basis for work, I wouldn't recommend. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Kim V.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic floor jack
customer_reviews.text: No problems. Got a t56 pulled out of my 04 Pontiac GTO with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Granturismo_omologato04

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The jack worked but the cylinder leaked oil and had to return the jack.
customer_reviews.author: john please golitko

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The hydraulic cylinder seal started bleeding off pressure under load about a month after the return period expired.
customer_reviews.author: John Petty

customer_reviews.title: transmission jack
customer_reviews.text: excellent buy,shipped fast and best price. this is the best jack for the money that I have ever owned. it performs well on even the biggest AUTOMOTIVE transmissions.i would highly recommend this product for the DIY driveway mechanic on a budget
customer_reviews.author: fred r keenan

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Only donw fall was the packaging was horrible. The box was busted up on arival but everthing was still ok.
customer_reviews.author: David York

customer_reviews.title: worked as it should
customer_reviews.text: these jacks work ok for home use. i had to make a bracket to make it work for what i needed. I probably overloaded this jack because i pulled the trans and transfer case on a four wheel drive ford as one piece. It did the job i needed it to.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: Priced according to the purpose it is intended for. Built sturdy and strong enough to hold up big transmissions on most vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon M. Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Is It Bait And Switch?
customer_reviews.text: The parts list in the operation manual and the actual jack you receive do not match. This is a cheaper version with the same model numbers. 1. angle brackets,no holes 2.No Hook Guides 3.1 chain not two 4.oil leak at cylinder pump on first use. I will call manufacturer for parts. If I do not get them, then jack goes back. UPDATE BEWARE OF PARTS AVAILABILITY, LEAKS UPON LEAKS DRIFTING AND CONSTANT SERVICE. BEWARE I'VE HAD MANY JACKS AND I PROMISE THIS WAS MY WORST BY FAR
customer_reviews.author: gstet

customer_reviews.title: Buy American! This is Import junk
customer_reviews.text: It is a cheap tool that is made in China. Did not work! Piece of junk. AMAZON- BUY AMERICAN
customer_reviews.author: John Schube

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first time we used it
customer_reviews.text: This jack is very poor quality. I am returning it. It broke the first time we used it and dropped the transmission on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Jeleni

product_meta.title: BIG RED TR4076 Torin Hydraulic Roll-Under Transmission Service/Floor Jack: 1/2 Ton (1,000 lb) Capacity, Red
product_meta.description: The Torin BIG RED TR4076 roll-under transmission floor jack offers smooth hydraulic lifting and lowering. With a lifting range from 8-11/16" to 22-11/16" and a 1/2 ton (1,000 lb) load capacity, this transmission jack is ideal for everyday garage service as well as heavy-duty industrial use. A safety-overload system helps prevent use beyond its rated capacity. It features a 360-degree rotating handle and an adjustable head and saddle. The saddle allows full side-to-side and front and back adjustment. Universal mounting head with a wide forward and aft tilt, making positioning easy. Equipped with (4) 360-degree swivel casters, delivering smooth and precise movements. The powder-coated finish prevents rust. Includes a 1 year limited manufacturer warranty.
feature_bullets: Transmission jack is ideal for everyday garage service as well as heavy-duty industrial use; Constructed of high-grade steel
Lifting range from 8-11/16" to 22-11/16" and a 1/2 ton (1,000 lb) load capacity; Safety-overload system prevents use beyond its rated capacity
Features a 360-degree rotating handle and an adjustable head and saddle; Powder-coated finish prevents rust
Universal mounting head with a wide forward and aft tilt, making positioning effortless
Equipped with (4) 360-degree swivel casters, delivering smooth and precise movements; Includes a 1 year limited manufacturer warranty
